alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greater Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:14AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Elbert, southeastern Hart, southeastern Greenville, west central Spartanburg, Anderson, east central Pickens and central Abbeville Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 914 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Greenville Downtown to 5 miles southwest of Easley to 8 miles southeast of Hartwell. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Anderson, Easley, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville and Berea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greater Pickens
